item.title: Password protect web services in Kubernetes (k3s/traefik) with basic auth
item.description: Now that I have a [high-available local kubernetes cluster](/s/tutorials/High_Available_k3s_kubernetes_cluster_with_keepalived_galera_and_longhorn.html) and am [experimenting with deploying apps](/s/snippets/Using_nodeSelector_to_deploy_a_Kubernetes_Helm_chart_only_on_x86_or_amd64_nodes_not_arm64.html), it's also time to look into securing those apps using certificates and passwords. In this case I'm going to set up password authentication, like a `.htaccess` file in `Apache2`, to protect the `Longhorn` dashboad, which by default requires no authentication. This means deploying an `Ingress`, a `Middleware` and a `Secret`.
